channel.title: [delta]how could i make this command?[delta]
channel.description: i want to make an command which sends any npc i spawn through the ::npc command into my autospawn.cfg to make it easier, how would it be done? im thinking something like, if.commandStartswith(npc)) { /config/autospawn.cfg am i close to what it would look like to send it into the autospawn? anything else i would have to do so it would format correctly into autospawn? i know that command was sloppy, i just thought of random stuff, my point was sending it to autospawn.cfg.

item.title: [delta]how could i make this command?[delta]
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

scotty_aura:

use the codes that these guys are suggesting but also find public void autospawn2 and edit the part that says “autospawncodes.txt” with quotes to say “autospawn.cfg” this will auto update your config file with the new npc where you are standing then all you have to do is compile and restart your server.

Are you fucking serious?

Gravedig…

Read full topic

item.title: [delta]how could i make this command?[delta]
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:18, topic:369451”]Try adding both of these commands.


if(command.startsWith("auto") && playerRights > 2){
			int npcid = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5));
			int absx = absX;
			int absy = absY;
appendToAutoSpawn(npcid, absx, absy);
sM("Npc added.");
}

if(command.startsWith("spawn") && playerRights > 2){ int npcid = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6)); int absx = absX; int absy = absY; appendToAutoSpawn(npcid, absx, absy, absX + 4, absY + 4, absX -4, absY - 4); sM("Npc added."); } [/quote]
the spawn didnt work, so i deleted that and decided to try auto command, it didnt get any compiling errors, but when i do the format
::spawn 76 1 1
i get dced
why?

item.title: [delta]how could i make this command?[delta]
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Try adding both of these commands.


if(command.startsWith("auto") && playerRights > 2){
			int npcid = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5));
			int absx = absX;
			int absy = absY;
appendToAutoSpawn(npcid, absx, absy);
sM("Npc added.");
}
if(command.startsWith("spawn") && playerRights > 2){
			int npcid = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6));
			int absx = absX;
			int absy = absY;
appendToAutoSpawn(npcid, absx, absy, absX + 4, absY + 4, absX -4, absY - 4);
sM("Npc added.");
}

item.title: [delta]how could i make this command?[delta]
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

mk, theres two, so i will just postem both

[code]public void appendToAutoSpawn(int npcid, int absx, int absy) {
BufferedWriter bw = null;

	try {
		bw = new BufferedWriter(
		new FileWriter("config//autospawncodes.txt", true));
		bw.write("spawn = "+npcid+"	"+absx+"	"+absy+"	0	0	0	0	0	1");
		bw.newLine();
		bw.flush();
	} catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	} finally {
		if (bw != null) {
			try {
				bw.close();
			} catch (IOException ioe2) {
				sM("Error autospawning!");
			}
		}
	}

}[/code]

number 2:

[code]public void appendToAutoSpawn2(int npcid, int absx, int absy, int absx2, int absy2, int absx3, int absy3) {

	BufferedWriter bw = null;

	try {
		bw = new BufferedWriter(
		new FileWriter("config//autospawncodes.txt", true));
		bw.write("spawn = "+npcid+"	"+absx+"	"+absy+"	0	"+absx2+"	"+absy2+"	"+absx3+"	"+absy3+"	1");
		bw.newLine();
		bw.flush();
	} catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	} finally {
		if (bw != null) {
			try {
				bw.close();
			} catch (IOException ioe2) {
				sM("Error autospawning!");
			}
		}
	}

[/code]
yes number 2 is right under number 1

Read full topic

item.title: [delta]how could i make this command?[delta]
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Oh yeah, add this void:


	public void appendToAutoSpawn(int npcid, int absx, int absy) {
		BufferedWriter bw = null;

		try {
			bw = new BufferedWriter(
					new FileWriter("config//autospawn.cfg", true));
			bw.write("spawn = "+npcid+"	"+absx+"	"+absy+"	0	0	0	0	0	1");
			bw.newLine();
			bw.flush();
		} catch (IOException ioe) {
			ioe.printStackTrace();
		} finally {
			if (bw != null) {
				try {
					bw.close();
				} catch (IOException ioe2) {
					sM("Error autospawning!");
				}
			}
		}

	}

Read full topic
